snippet: Facing increasing pressure and scrutiny from death penalty opponents, the makers of several drugs used in lethal injections have ceased production or required that they not be used in executions.
abstract: Makers of several drugs used in lethal injections across nation have ceased production as states, responding to increasing pressure and scrutiny from death penalty opponents, stop using them for executions; decision by manufacturers has left many of nation's 32 death penalty states scrambling to come up with new drugs and protocols, leading to delays in executions.

byline.contributor: Katherine Fretland contributed reporting from New Orleans.

lead_paragraph: Facing increasing pressure and scrutiny from death penalty opponents, the makers of several drugs used in lethal injections have ceased production or required that they not be used in executions.

headline.main: Executions Stall as States Seek Different Drugs
headline.print_headline: Executions Stall As States Seek Different Drugs
